fields.description: Users with custom domains have various issues. We are working to repair them all. Please add your incidences of these here.

I tried to strip some commits from my repo and now my repo

https://bitbucket.org/KChambers/kris_gloss

is unavailable.

Also, the stripping has always failed to produce a bundle after it completed.

can't access commit info.\\
I try to open a first commit in master branch clicking on commit number on changesets page. It's provide 500 error page for whole day

I have big difficulties with users to report an issue properly. They never include enough details to describe an issue. I would be wonderful if you provide an option to write a template for the issues. So, when a new issue is created, the Description field is auto-filled with the template text. For example:

Environment:

Steps to reproduce:

Unexpected result:

Expected result:

Other comments:

I applied Stripping Changeset to my repository, but it is taking hours to finish..\\
The branch I wanted to "strip" was composed of only two commits.\\
I'd like to know if it's a bug, or the stripping process can take so long!

My account was denied on reading and writing for some repositories that I not belong anymore. It is ok.

But the repositories are still there, on my dashboard. They are displayed together with the ones that I follow, but I was not expecting this behavior and could not circumvent this on management user interface.
fields.summary: Denied project remains on my dashboard
The commits made in a branch other than "master" does not appear in the newsfeed (BB-6666)

fields.description:
Hi,

I seen which only the master readme (readme on master branch) is showed. When i select an other branch, it's again the master readme which is showed. I don't know if it's a bug, but it's really annoying.

Why not show each Readme of each folder?

best regards
I got a error 505 when click to https://bitbucket.org/yuksbg/grabo-club-client/changeset/a362a6891efee5fd5aa7f3a1ca17a599e3eacd3a
Are there any plans to integrate bitbucket with TeamBox, in a similar fashion as github?

I am looking for the repo ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-issue-collector-plugin

I am putting "atlassian/jira-issue-collector-plugin" into all possible search boxes and nothing happens.

It only sees it by name (atlassian/JIRA Issue Collector Plugin) - but as a person who hasn't developed it for a while, how would I remember it???

Guys, I understand the "use friendly names" concept, but please don't cripple the most important functionality to achieve that (find on BitBucket what I have in my hg repository)

My first impression was - some _%$@%$_ has removed my repository without telling me.
fields.summary: Searching for owner/reponame does not always return the result (BB-6519)

fields.description:
This is a minor interface bug.

* I added a new group to a team;
* I then added a member to this new group who was _already in another group_
* I then tried to delete them from the existing group.  The delete button would not work.

After moving away from the Groups page to another page and then back, I was able to delete them.
fields.summary: Unable to delete user from group

GMT +7, 09:40.\\

Whenever I create a new repository on my team account, the access management page shows that my 'Developers' and 'Admin' group have admin access to this repo. However, they can't actually access it. They can if I remove the group entry and manually add it back again.
fields.summary: Group members not given access to new repositories.

fields.description:
Instead of "Billy O'Neal", in the new username aliases UI the apostrophe comes out broken. See the attached screenshot.

Expected behavior: "Billy O'Neal" displayed on the page.\\
Actual behavior: "Billy O'Neal" displayed on the page.

fields.description: When uploading a new "artifact" to the Downloads page of my project, there is no upload progress indicator, once the user presses "Add file"
fields.summary: Add an upload progress indicator on the add "download" artifact page (BB-6679)

fields.description:
Hi Bitbucket team!

I was inviting a friend of mine to a private repo (jonlim/match-3 if you're curious) and I, being rude and impatient, invited him while waiting on him accepting my invite to Bitbucket in general.

To reproduce:

# Invite friend to Bitbucket (for up to 3 extra users!)
# Invite friend to repo
# Friend accepts invite from step 1, doesn't see anything about repo
# Can't re-invite friend to repo because friend already invited
fields.summary: Inviting a user while inviting a user

fields.description: I am using this in conjunction with Adafruit's WebIDE. However, only occasionally do the commits show up. I lost a lot of data already because of this. I will be contacting them too to report this bug because it is likely the software that is still in alpha.

Go in the search bar. Enter text and validate.\\
500 error page is displayed

On the main bitbucket front page that has the newsfeed, the Team widget on the right hand column displays an incorrect member count for our team. We have 2 members on the team which is also indicated by the actual team page and confirmed in the team member management page. However, on that front page widget the team member count is 3.
fields.summary: Incorrect team member count on bitbucket front page. (BB-6597)

fields.description:
Hi there !! Congrats to Atlassian for your work on BB!!

I've been reading about creating brokers, and got an idea that maybe cannot be implemented yet. As an OpenERP developer, I find interesting to have the possibility to develop a broker that sends issues to my OpenERP Issues tracker as soon as a new issue is entered into BitBucket. In its finest version, BB issue would be saved as OpenERP issue and bound to an OpenERP project.

But I think this is not possible with the data currently contained in the payload this broker would receive. Do you think this could be a good idea? Have you got some plans? Do I forget about this by now?
Plain text readme files are displayed in an ugly textbox. See https://bitbucket.org/accursoft/binding/overview and https://bitbucket.org/accursoft/binding/src for examples.

Hi Nicolas, could you help me?

I'm having problems with my repository "Stack". When I perform a "pull" or "commit", the server returns me the following error:

"abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!"

Thank you for your attention and look forward news.

hugs,\\
Thiago
fields.summary: remote: abort: abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!

fields.description:
Blame is reporting wrong lines for many lines in Git. I'm not sure how to best report it, as it's happening in one of my private repositories

https://bitbucket.org/sliceone/src/annotate/2b7b056c862deb0ab83e7d4de1ce583d272f36b9/httpserver/controllers/index.go?at=master

(blame for line 14 is wrong; there are probably others)

As you can see in screenshots, the commit blame is linking line 14 to doesn't even contain the file I'm using blame on.
fields.summary: Blame ignores top line if it contains no text (BB-6595)

fields.description:
In games where I go first, when trying to raid resources from green (pirate) the "OK"-button does not appear at the AI keeps the resources even if I get them also.   It seems OK with the blue opponent.\\
The AI seems to have no trouble when raiding me if I am green.

Besides that, allow me to recommend You guys on a great app.

Sincerely Yours\\
Klaus Vangsgaard Hansen
fields.summary: Unable to raid resources from green pirate AI

fields.description:
I followed a bunch of private repos when a member of a previous organisation/team (the repos belonged to the organisation). Now I am no longer part of the organisation (simplestream) but they still appear in my dashboard -> http://cl.ly/image/2Q0z1A142D1f

I can see no way to remove them from the dashboard. I've put this down as a UI bug although I suspect it probably goes a bit deeper than that.
fields.summary: Can't unfollow private team repos that user no longer has access to

fields.description:
Good Morning,

Since yesterday afternoon, I can’t see the commits I have made on Bitbucket using Git Bash until now.

Here is the url https://bitbucket.org/softpc/loma/changesets.

Now there is just 3 commits and there where more than 30.

My user is simon_softpc

Regards,

I can see dead... repository links! :)

A few weeks ago I worked for an agency and got access to some projects. After I have finished my job, they of course revoked access, but for some reason I can still see these projects/repositories.

I manually jumped to these projects and revoked given permissions by myself - since this moment, I am carried to error pages after clicking the repository links.

https://bitbucket.org/easywebstore/easywebstore/issues/1?status=new&status=open&sort=-priority&kind=enhancement

https://bitbucket.org/easywebstore/easywebstore/issues/2?status=new&status=open&sort=-priority&kind=enhancement

The second link above is Page 2... yet it contains some of the issues found on Page 1.  I've checked that they are not in fact duplicates but are the exact same issues.

Some of the issues on page 2 are different

It does this on ever page.  Also, it's not like the top few are from the previous page.. they are interspersed all the way down the list.  It's bizarre and quite annoying when trying to browse through all bugs, etc.
fields.summary: Paging results include previous pages issues in current page

fields.description: lol

I am behind the proxy I get this warning when pushing from hg mercurial:

pushing to https://user@bitbucket.org/user/project\\
warning: bitbucket.org certificate with fingerprint bf:8b:48:f8:a5:22:43:fd:d2:7\\
9:bc:1e:6b:c7:19:20:a6:ef:c5:ed not verified (check hostfingerprints or web.cace\\
rts config setting)\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
After googling I have found out that valid bitbucket.org certificate fingerprint starts with 81:

I suspect that proxy is trying to fake the certificate to attack as man-in-the-middle to decrypt the traffic.

Is there a way I can download and install bitbucket.org certificate into mercurial hg and not getting a fake one from proxy?

Current it suggest as below. But actually if you do this it won't import any branches or tags. Maybe you should suggest: git push --mirror ssh://git@bitbucket.org/paycorp/vha-report.git instead?

----
Import an existing repository\\
You already have a Git repository on your computer. Let's publish it to Bitbucket.

$ cd /path/to/my/repo\\
$ git remote add origin ssh://git@bitbucket.org/paycorp/vha-report.git\\
$ git push -u origin master   # to push changes for the first time\\
Do you want to grab a repo from another site? Try our Importer!
fields.summary: Change the import existing repository help text (BB-6591)

fields.description:
Bitbucket

I'm trying to push my commit code but I receive a git-http-push failed

user: jllanes_ss\\
repo: ss_mundose_site

Thanks in advance

Regards\\
Juan

I was working for a company and had "followed" some repos. I left, they removed my access, and yet those still show up on my dashboard and such along with the repos I still own. There should be a way to stop following a repo after access is cut OR have this done automatically when the access changes.
When I go to "merge" the pull request, once I've hit "Accept Pull Request", the page just sits there doing nothing, with the loader gif rotating forever.

Today, right after I closed a branch in my repo, I received a pull-request where the patch happened to be based on the branch that I just closed. It's not the end of world, but it's extra effort for merging. This accident can be easily avoided if I was aware that the other developer has done some work in his fork.

I think the design of the new bitbucket webpage can be improved to make it such mistakes harder to happen: On the overview page of a repository, when user clicks "Forks", a pulldown menu will show up on the page to list the current forks. See the attached image for an example. The menu can be improved to show a bit more information. One essential part is the number commits that the forker has done within his fork. Bitbucket's old webpage design has this information, and therefore I assume there's no technical difficulty to add it back. This information is especially useful for developers of the original repo.

PS. I am unsure which component this issue belongs to, but I chose "toothpaste" because this is the most interesting option in the list.
fields.summary: Show number of commits done within a fork on Overview page (BB-6590)

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/repo/all/relevance?name=lib&language=c
I just committed and date of master branch download says 21 minutes ago, but shows the right commit hash

Code here has css class=err on some punctuation in lines starting "yield from".

https://bitbucket.org/sbt/tulip-proactor/src/tip/http_client.py

Also, the "from" and "import" keywords aren't properly highlighted. Please support all keywords, which are listed here:

http://docs.python.org/3.4/reference/lexical_analysis.html#keywords
fields.summary: Python syntax highlighting doesn't understand "yield from"

Hi there,

I'm fairly new to Git (and BitBucket.. so hopefully I'm doing the right thing by posting this here). I've got a bitbucket repo setup and the initial pushes into the repo worked flawlessly. However, I decided that it was time to actually be productive with my project and now when I try to push.. this happens:

{code}
#!python
$ git push -u origin master
Password for 'https://chemicalNova@bitbucket.org':
Counting objects: 171, done.
Delta compression using up to 2 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (150/150), done.
error: RPC failed; result=22, HTTP code = 411
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
Writing objects: 100% (162/162), 3.25 MiB | 665 KiB/s, done.
Total 162 (delta 55), reused 0 (delta 0)
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
Everything up-to-date
{code}

Nothing ends up in my repo on BitBucket. The local copy is fine however. Is there something that I'm doing wrong? I see two "fatal" labels and an "error" label there.. so I'm not sure if it's my issue or BitBuckets. Unfortunately, Google appears to throw back various unrelated results.
https works fine.
This happened after logout.

In OnDemand instances that still have integrated Fisheye and Crucible, we can create conditions/post functions in workflows based on reviews or commits presented on FeCru.\\
It's very important that those post functions/conditions become available for Bitbucket integration too.
fields.summary: Create conditions in workflow based on reviews in Bitbucket

When I run hg clone -r stable ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/sproutsocial/tireswing, the most recent changeset is "5049:4cd589e58a9b".

However, the most recent changeset listed on BitBucket is 87fa75f, which occurs two commits after 5049.

Hello there, I don't want to seem retarded but since few days I can't do anything on my repo anymore.

When I want to clone, push or pull one of my repo, I've got a 'fatal: Authentication failed'

Here is my git config of one of my repo:

{code}
#!python
[core]
    repositoryformatversion = 0
    filemode = true
    bare = false
    logallrefupdates = true
[remote "origin"]
    fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*
    url = https://depierre@bitbucket.org/depierre/ag44pow4.git
[branch "master"]
    remote = origin
    merge = refs/heads/master
[http]
    postBuffer = 524288000
{code}

fields.description:
[This is what a page-only TOC (a table of contents that only lists sub-topics within a page) looks like.|https://bitbucket.org/alfonse/glloadgen/wiki/Styles] That's bad.

A TOC should not be indented like that, even if it's only for subtopics in that page.

{code}
fields.summary: Wiki page with 100+ links don't parse correctly (BB-6507)

fields.description:
Take this commit message:

{{fix BCLOUD-13; make "Proof only my language" faster}}

{{#13}} won't be linked to issue BCLOUD-13, presumably because the ";" after it is confusing the parser.

(Oddly, it does work here and my issue has been properly closed in the tracker, but when looking at the commit history tab, it remains unlinked.)
fields.summary: Issue no. in commit message not linked to issue tracker if followed by punctuation (BB-6506)

fields.description:
VLC reads all video but SPlayer won't.\\
Operating system is Lion newest version.

Refund my money for the app if this app won't work!

The RSS and Atom formats of personal news feeds lack any content for changset comment entries. They just say

bq. Username *cset_comment_created* Repository


They are also missing a link to the changeset comment, and instead just point to the BitBucket homepage.
fields.summary: Blank Changeset Comment entries in Feeds

fields.description: The feed on my bitbucket front page contains entries about changeset comments. But when I subscribe to the feed in Thunderbird, they do not show up. I think it is because they all have the same ID: <guid isPermaLink="true">https://bitbucket.org/</guid>
fields.summary: Changeset comments do not show up in feed reader

fields.description:
If you have a repo A, then you fork A (call the forked repo B), then merge B back into A, the links for the pull requests on commits to B will be incorrect.

More specifically, if you merge [PR#3|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/3] into B, then it has a commit that says ([PR#3|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/3]) and has a link for the third pull request of B. However, if you then merge B into A, the commit still says ([PR#3|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/3]), but it has no memory of the earlier repo and links to the third pull request of A.
fields.summary: Pull request commit on forks has the wrong link when merged into master

fields.description:
I just tried to create an issue at

http://dev.libqxt.org/libqxt/issues/new

but upon entering all the data and clicking "Create issue" I only get the "Oops, you've found a dead link." page.

If I click on "Support" at the botton of the Error Page, I get yet another 404.

I'm curious whether this happens with this ticket as well.

TIA for any pointer,

Elwood

fields.summary: access denied when cloning wiki over ssh

fields.description: The word you has been repeated twice on the Invitation Dialog : "has invited you you"
I found a little bug related with a dead link when a custom domain is set, If you try to navigate across the repositories using the main menu it fail :(.
fields.summary: Dead link when there is a custom domain

fields.description: The new newsfeeds are sweet! But it would be greater if there will be about 5 times more items shown in it :) I understand that bitbucket supposely deletes older newsfeed items, but maybe you can afford longer newsfeeds? :)

Hello there!\\
My name's Orestes, i'm a software developer at a company named Focus On Emotions based in Barcelona. We've been tinkering with git for a while and we love the way Bitbucket manages the teams, users and repos. We find the repo history graph really well thought.

We've started a new private repo for one of our apps named nds, and we've been playing around with branches, merges, etc.

However, we're confused with some things.

If we [take a look at the repo changeset list|https://bitbucket.org/focusonemotions/nds/changesets] we see that some commits have a tag indicating the branch were they were made. Clicking on the tag takes you to an url showing the changeset of the branch.

We have a branch named ppt, and we can [take a look at the  branche's changeset list|https://bitbucket.org/focusonemotions/nds/changesets/tip/ppt]  but there's no tag on the displayed commits. Furthermore, when reviewing the details of one of the commits,\\
[1b61c57|https://bitbucket.org/focusonemotions/nds/changeset/1b61c57ae1d9582fc281c9688c5d3776b8fa0354], it shows as being on the master branch, when it isn't.

I cant clone the wiki of the repository in wich I am working.\\
The repository is private and the wiki too, but I have permissions of write in the repository.

The fault that git give me is:\\
Cloning into wiki...\\
conq: repository access denied.\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
I don't know who should be assigned this issue, assigned random, sorry.
fields.summary: Can't see detail between commits when only modify file attribute

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/monomachus/dailyflow/changeset/72426fcbde33d529ed734f9afc5a72b1e29d3c56

If you comment on an initially-hidden line, it is hidden from view on subsequent page loads; even if you arrive via the deep link. So, basically, you're wasting your time.

Also annoying is you cna't reveal the whole file in one click, in the initial case I have to click expand three times in a row to get to the comment.

Steps to reproduce:

# open a Pull Request with a long file
# expand an area of the file that wasn't edited
# comment on a line in the initally-hidden area
# copy the deep link
# open a new window to that deep link - comment is not revealed (screenshot 1)
# scroll down the relevant file - comment still not revealed (screenshot 2)
# expand the file until you find the comment (screenshot 3)

Page where I identified the problem:\\
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive/pull-request/150/aui-974-first-cut-of-a-soy-servlet/diff

The deep link is https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive/pull-request/150/aui-974-first-cut-of-a-soy-servlet/diff#comment-35092

The comment is in auiplugin-tests/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml
fields.summary: PR comments on initially-hidden lines are hidden

fields.description:
Hi Adam

We tried to add a new developer to our account, it looks like it half worked.

The email address shows as registered when we try to sign up, but fails to get the password reset.

The email is *REMOVED*

Dale

I have a feeling that the timing of events is off by one hour and it may be related to the date on which we switch to/from daylight-saving time - it changed a few years ago.

Jim Wiliams

The BB web GUI does not display correctly in IE8 or IE9.

Selectors are very difficult to use.

Please see attached screenshot taken from Win7/IE9
fields.summary: New BB i/f very difficult to use in IE9

fields.description: In Windows 8 the WebAuthenticationBroker uses a fixed width chromeless browser for OAuth authorisation. Because the Bitbucket authorise page is non-responsive the UX is impaired.

I am working with integrating Windows Azure with Bitbucket and have the following request.  When presented with OAuth page, if user accepts (allows), the callback happens with proper oauth_token. It would be nice, when user denies (cancels), the callback also happen with empty oauth_token (currently, no callback at all).

In the OAuth1.0a spec (http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/), it mentioned that the Consumer _may_ be notified in such event - so it is upto implementors.

This would enable application to handle and proceed appropriately. GitHub (OAuth2.0)/CodePlex(OAuth1.0a) do exactly that.
fields.summary: OAuth to callback when user cancels (denies). (BB-6662)

fields.description: When I create a new repository, go to "Invite your friends" > "Send an invitation", and send it successfully, the resulting message says "*Invit_i_ation* sent to foo@bar.com". It should say "Invitation".

When I transfer ownership of a repo from my account to a Team on which I have administrative access, the transfer should be instant. Now it seems I have to transfer using my account and then login to the Team account and accept the transfer before it actually occurs.

God day\\
I just checked the Phone specifications and the iPad specs is wrong i attached a file.

Im trying to follow the instructions on http://help.pagodabox.com/customer/portal/articles/221647. To add my private repository as a submodule, I need to add the pagodabox public key, but when I try I get: "Someone has already registered that SSH key."

I don't see the point that more than one user cant register a public key. I can think of several cases when this would need to be done. Can you please remove this restriction?
fields.summary: Can't register public key / Can't add Pagodabox's key

fields.description:
When I click to create (edit) issue button (form is generated OK) it generates 404 error. I have found where the problem is:

On bitbucket, there are repositories behind url in this format: http://bitbucket.org/[user]/[repo]/*

On custom domain, they are behind url: http://[domain]/[repo]/*

But the Create/edit button calls action on the url in format: http://[domain]/*[user]*/[repo]/issues/new..  And that's the problem.

Sorry for some english mistakes, but I'm not native english...
fields.summary: Cannot create/edit issue on custom domain

fields.description:
This is my pull request...

https://bitbucket.org/ldave/buymyplace/pull-request/265/ie-error-for-facebook-icon-innerhtml-probs

PFA is the error message when I open this url.
fields.summary: "Something went wrong " message comes when I open pull request

fields.description:
Hi,

First thanks a lot for this awsome website !\\
With our team - we developp iOs Apps - we think that adding a screenshot for each repository would be a great help to manage our sources, we think that this visual element will ease user exeperience.

Let me know if you want to talk more about that.

Best regards\\
Guillaume
fields.summary: Easily manage and browse soucres : Adding a screenshot per repository

fields.description: A way to to make a repository accessible to everybody who has a BitBucket account and track who download it (email address of downloader)?

Great job with the new look on the Wiki! It looks much better and it is much more appealing to work with.

One minor, in the previous version while editing a page tab would highligt the save button. Very convenient with tab, enter to save when I was finished. In the new version though the bitbucket home at top left gets highlighted. Although it follows some kind of standard it's not as useful. (I'd rather save before going to bitbucket.com)

Once again, great job with the new look!

the workflow of a bug/issue should be -\\
new -> open (when assgined to a dev) -> resolved -> closed (after QA verified the fix is OK)
fields.summary: Add a status of "Closed" to issues (BB-10249)

fields.description: users are flooded with notifications. They would like to see issues when they are assigned to them only, or when a comment or anything is added to an issue which is assigned to them
fields.summary: please allow better management for notificadtions (BB-6493)

fields.description:
Hello.

My goal is to see difference between two branches.\\
https://bitbucket.org/mebelrama/complex/compare/release..master\\
There are near 50 commits. Earlier Bitbucket was able to draw diff between them. But since today there is a message "This diff is too big for us to render." for all diffs even those with 1 line being changed. Could you please fix this issue.\\
This feature is very important for me while doing pre-release code review.\\
Thanks in advance
fields.summary: This diff is too big for us to render.

fields.description: сейчас в єтот отчет попадают данніе по отчетной и уточненной декларации все вместе. єту ведомость надо разделять отдельно по отчету, отдельно уточненка на каждую дату, т.е.  должно біть поле для указания даты уточн.
не понятно как нумерует декларации. все время единица. этот номер можно же отслеживать по таблице звытов??
